intro: Galianthe cristata, commonly known as the crested galianthe, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features a tall, slender stem with finely divided leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or coastal environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
